description: A rich and creamy tomato-based curry with paneer cubes, perfect with naan or rice.
instructions: Heat butter in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté for a minute.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, chili powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Add cream, garam masala, and paneer cubes. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot.

description: A flavorful rice dish cooked with marinated chicken, aromatic spices, and saffron.
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, spices, and salt for 1 hour.
Fry onions until golden brown and set aside.
Cook chicken in a pan with tomatoes and spices until tender.
Boil basmati rice until 70% cooked, then drain.
Layer chicken, rice, saffron milk, and fried onions in a pot.
Seal the pot and cook on low heat for 20 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and mint leaves before serving.

description: A fragrant and delicious mutton biryani cooked with tender mutton, spices, and basmati rice.
instructions: Marinate mutton with yogurt, spices, and salt for 2 hours.
Fry onions until golden brown and set aside.
Cook mutton in a pan with tomatoes, spices, and water until tender.
Boil basmati rice until 70% cooked, then drain.
Layer mutton, rice, saffron milk, and fried onions in a pot.
Seal the pot and cook on low heat for 30 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and mint leaves before serving.

description: A delectable seafood biryani made with prawns, fragrant spices, and basmati rice.
instructions: Marinate prawns with yogurt, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt for 30 minutes.
Fry onions until golden brown and set aside.
Cook prawns in a pan with tomatoes, spices, and little water until just done.
Boil basmati rice until 70% cooked, then drain.
Layer prawns, rice, saffron milk, and fried onions in a pot.
Seal the pot and cook on low heat for 15 minutes.
Garnish with coriander and mint leaves before serving.

description: A tangy and spicy chicken curry made with sorrel leaves (Gongura) and flavorful spices.
instructions: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions, green chilies, and sauté until onions turn golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and sauté until raw smell disappears.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, and coriander powder. Cook until tomatoes soften.
Add chicken pieces, salt, and cook until chicken turns tender.
Add chopped gongura leaves and mix well. Cover and cook until leaves soften and blend with the curry.
Sprinkle garam masala, mix well, and cook for another 5 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

description: A traditional South Indian lentil stew made with toor dal, vegetables, tamarind, and aromatic spices.
instructions: Rinse and pressure cook toor dal with water and turmeric until soft. Mash it well and keep aside.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, dry red chilies, asafoetida, and curry leaves. Sauté for a few seconds.
Add onions, tomatoes, carrots, okra, and drumstick. Sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Add tamarind pulp, red chili powder, sambar powder, and salt. Mix well.
Add 2 cups of water and let the vegetables cook until soft.
Add mashed dal and mix well. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or idli.

description: A classic Indian dish of marinated chicken grilled to perfection with smoky and spicy flavors.
instructions: Make deep cuts on the chicken pieces to help absorb the marinade.
In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, lemon juice, all the spices, mustard oil, and salt.
Coat the chicken pieces with the marinade and let it rest for at least 1 hour (preferably overnight for better flavor).
Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F) or heat a grill.
Place chicken on a greased tray or grill and cook for 25-30 minutes, basting with butter occasionally.
Turn the chicken pieces halfway through to ensure even cooking.
Once charred and cooked through, remove from heat.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve with lemon wedges and mint chutney.

description: A flavorful Indian lentil dish made with toor dal, tempered with ghee, garlic, and spices.
instructions: Rinse and pressure cook toor dal with turmeric and water until soft. Mash well and set aside.
Heat 1 tbsp ghee in a pan, sauté onions until golden, then add ginger-garlic paste and tomatoes.
Cook until tomatoes soften, then add red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix well.
Add the cooked dal, mix, and simmer for 5-7 minutes.
For tempering, heat remaining ghee, add mustard seeds, cumin, dry red chilies, garlic, curry leaves, and hing.
Pour the tempering over the dal and mix.
Garnish with coriander leaves and lemon juice. Serve hot with rice or roti.

description: A delicious and healthy stuffed Indian flatbread made with green peas and aromatic spices.
instructions: In a bowl, mix whole wheat flour, salt, and water to form a soft dough. Let it rest for 20 minutes.
In a pan, heat oil, add green chili, grated ginger, and mashed peas. Sauté for 2-3 minutes.
Add cumin powder, garam masala, coriander powder, turmeric, and salt. Mix well and cook for a minute.
Turn off the heat, add coriander leaves, and let the filling cool.
Divide the dough into equal portions and roll into small discs.
Place a portion of the pea filling in the center and seal the dough.
Roll it gently into a flat paratha using a rolling pin.
Heat a tawa (griddle) and cook the paratha on both sides, applying ghee or butter until golden brown.
Serve hot with yogurt or pickle.

description: A crispy and flaky pastry filled with spiced mashed potatoes, deep-fried to golden perfection.
instructions: In a bowl, mix flour, salt, and oil. Add water gradually and knead into a stiff dough. Cover and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan, add cumin seeds, green chili, and ginger. Sauté for a minute.
Add green peas, mashed potatoes, coriander powder, garam masala, red chili powder, amchur, and salt. Mix well.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, add coriander leaves, and let the filling cool.
Divide the dough into small balls, roll into thin circles, and cut in half.
Shape each half into a cone, fill with potato mixture, and seal the edges with water.
Heat oil in a deep pan and fry samosas on medium-low heat until golden brown and crispy.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with chutney or ketchup.

description: A crispy and spicy North Indian potato patty, perfect as a snack or served with chutney.
instructions: In a bowl, mix mashed potatoes, bread crumbs, corn flour, green chili, ginger, and all the spices.
Add salt and chopped coriander leaves, then mix well to form a dough-like mixture.
Divide into equal portions and shape into round, flat tikkis.
Heat oil in a pan and shallow-fry the tikkis on medium heat until golden brown on both sides.
Drain on paper towels and serve hot with green chutney or ketchup.

description: A popular Mumbai street food dish made with a spiced mashed vegetable curry served with buttered pav.
instructions: Boil cauliflower, peas, and carrots until soft. Mash them along with potatoes and set aside.
Heat butter in a pan, sauté onions until golden, then add green chili and ginger-garlic paste.
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes turn mushy.
Add the mashed vegetables and pav bhaji masala. Mix well and simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Add lemon juice and garnish with coriander leaves.
Toast pav with butter on a tawa until golden brown.
Serve hot with bhaji, extra butter, and chopped onions.

description: A healthy and flavorful baked salmon fillet with garlic, lemon, and herbs.
instructions: Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, black pepper, salt, paprika, oregano, and thyme.
Place salmon fillets on the baking sheet and brush them with the prepared mixture.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Garnish with fresh parsley and lemon slices before serving.

description: Soft and fluffy lentil dumplings soaked in spiced yogurt and garnished with chutneys and spices.
ingredients: 1 cup Urad Dal (split black gram, soaked for 6 hours)
1/4 cup Moong Dal (optional, soaked for 6 hours)
instructions: Grind the soaked urad dal and moong dal into a smooth batter with minimal water.
Add salt, cumin seeds, and ginger. Mix well and let it rest for 30 minutes.
Heat oil in a deep pan. Drop spoonfuls of batter into the hot oil and fry until golden brown.
Soak the fried vadas in warm water for 10 minutes, then gently squeeze out excess water.
Whisk the yogurt until smooth. Add salt and mix well.
Place the vadas in a serving dish and pour the yogurt over them.
Drizzle with tamarind and green chutney, and sprinkle cumin powder, red chili powder, and chaat masala.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and sev (optional). Serve chilled.

description: A rich and flavorful Hyderabadi-style eggplant curry made with roasted spices and a tangy tamarind base.
instructions: Dry roast peanuts, sesame seeds, coconut, coriander seeds, and red chilies. Grind into a smooth paste with little water.
Wash and slit the eggplants, keeping the stem intact.
Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, and curry leaves. Let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until raw smell disappears.
Add turmeric, red chili powder, and the prepared masala paste. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
Add tamarind pulp, jaggery (optional), and salt. Mix well.
Place the eggplants in the pan and coat them with the masala. Add a little water if needed.
Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes until the eggplants are tender.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with rice or roti.

description: A comforting and flavorful North Indian kidney bean curry cooked in a rich tomato-based gravy.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp Kasuri Methi (Dried Fenugreek Leaves, optional)
instructions: Pressure cook the soaked rajma with 3 cups of water and a little salt for 15-20 minutes or until soft.
Heat oil or butter in a pan, add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until the raw smell disappears.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, and salt. Cook until oil separates.
Mash some cooked rajma and add it along with the remaining beans to the gravy.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes. Add garam masala, kasuri methi, and fresh cream (optional).
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice or roti.
